title: Serpentine Gallery Pavilion, leading world venue for architectural experimentationTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Serpentine Gallery Pavilion, leading world venue for architectural experimentation
Serpentine Gallery Pavilion, one of the leading world venues for architectural experimentation, is underway in London. This year the Pavillion is designed by Spanish architects SelgasCano.
A different creative is commissioned every year to create a temporary structure.
For the pavilion’s 15th year, SelgasCano, led by the creative talents of José Selgas and Lucía Cano, are making their first foray into UK architecture with the construct.
Previous designs from SelgasCano include light-filled harbourside structures, playful floating shapes and even the subterranean Office in the Woods.
The only rules of their brief is that the design should be for a flexible, multi-purpose social space that offers a café for visitors throughout the summer months.
The work by the Spanish team promises to contrast with the 2014 effort by Smiljan Radić, whose structure was said to resemble a spaceship lying on Neolithic stones.
